001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003/**
004 * This class implements a true 2D bitmap container, i.e., each 0/1 element
005 * occupies only a single bit (unlike {@code boolean} arrays, which require at 
006 * least 8 bits per element).
007 * 
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2021/01/30
010 */
011public class BitMap {
012        
013        /** the width of this bitmap */
014        public final int width;
015        /** the height of this bitmap */
016        public final int height;
017        
018        private final BitVector bitvec;
019        
020        /**
021         * Constructor.
022         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
023         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
024         */
025        public BitMap(int width, int height) {
026                this.width = width;
027                this.height = height;
028                this.bitvec = BitVector.create(width * height);
029        }
030        
031        /**
032         * Factory method.
033         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
034         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
035         * @return a new bitmap with the specified size
036         */
037        public static BitMap create(int width, int height) {
038                return new BitMap(width, height);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
043         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
044         * @param x the x-coordinate
045         * @param y the y-coordinate
046         * @return as described
047         */
048        public boolean get(int x, int y) {
049                return bitvec.get(y * width + x);
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
054         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
055         * @param x the x-coordinate
056         * @param y the y-coordinate
057         * @param val a boolean value
058         */
059        public void set(int x, int y, boolean val) {
060                if (val) {
061                        this.set(x, y);
062                }
063                else {
064                        this.unset(x, y);
065                }
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
070         * @param x the x-coordinate
071         * @param y the y-coordinate
072         */
073        public void set(int x, int y) {
074                bitvec.set(y * width + x);
075        }
076        
077        /**
078         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
079         * @param x the x-coordinate
080         * @param y the y-coordinate
081         */
082        public void unset(int x, int y) {
083                bitvec.unset(y * width + x);
084        }
085        
086        /**
087         * Sets all element values to 1.
088         */
089        public void setAll() {
090                bitvec.setAll();
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Sets all element values to 0.
095         */
096        public void unsetAll() {
097                bitvec.unsetAll();
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Returns the underlying 1D {@link BitVector}.
102         * @return the bitvector
103         */
104        public BitVector getBitVector() {
105                return this.bitvec;
106        }
107
108}
